summary: An interview conducted by Murray Hiebert with Sri Mulyani Indrawati, focusing on economic and political challenges in Southeast Asia.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a blue screen displaying the text "CSIS" in large white letters, followed by "CENTER FOR STRATEGIC & INTERNATIONAL STUDIES" in smaller white letters. The background features a world map in a lighter shade of blue. The scene transitions to a title card with the text "Murray Hiebert Interviews Sri Mulyani Indrawati, World Bank Managing Director" in white letters on a blue background. The next scene shows a man in a suit and tie standing in front of a backdrop with the CSIS logo, identified as "Murray Hiebert, Deputy Director and Senior Fellow, Southeast Asia Program." The video then cuts to a woman in a floral-patterned jacket, also standing in front of the CSIS backdrop, identified as "Sri Mulyani Indrawati, World Bank Managing Director." The video alternates between shots of the man and the woman as they engage in an interview, with the CSIS logo and text consistently visible in the background. The video concludes with a return to the blue screen displaying the CSIS logo and text.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with upbeat, jazzy instrumental music, which creates a light and positive mood. A man introduces himself and his guest for a Southeast Asian program dialogue. He mentions the guest is the Managing Director of the World Bank and former Finance Minister of Indonesia. He then welcomes her. He mentions he will be asking questions.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a woman and a man speaking in front of a backdrop with the text "CSIS CENTER FOR STRATEGIC & INTERNATIONAL STUDIES" repeatedly printed on it. The woman, wearing a grey floral-patterned jacket and glasses, appears to be listening attentively. The man, dressed in a dark suit with a light blue shirt and an orange tie, is speaking and gesturing with his hands. The setting suggests a formal event or conference, with the CSIS branding indicating a focus on strategic and international studies. The atmosphere is professional, and the speakers seem engaged in a discussion or presentation.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker stating he would "like to ask you, there's slowing economic growth in in Southeast Asia". He speaks in a relatively serious and neutral tone, expressing concerns about the potential impact on "political stability".

events_list.video_caption: The video features a formal discussion at the Center for Strategic & International Studies (CSIS), as indicated by the backdrop. It begins with a man in a dark suit, light blue shirt, and orange tie, speaking and gesturing with his hands. The scene transitions to a woman with short dark hair, wearing glasses and a blue floral-patterned jacket, who is also speaking and gesturing. The video alternates between close-ups of the man and the woman, highlighting their expressions and gestures as they engage in a dialogue. The consistent backdrop and professional attire suggest a serious and academic atmosphere. The video concludes with a wider shot of both individuals, emphasizing their interaction and the formal setting.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio features a conversation between two speakers, one male and one female, discussing the link between economic performance and political stability. The female speaker responds with an analysis of the effects of an economic slowdown, particularly on Southeast Asia. She expresses that the slowdown is caused by global and domestic factors, and may pressure political accountability and democratic consolidation. In the specific case of Indonesia, she argues that slower economic growth can reinforce the need for the government to prioritize policies and resources to protect the poor and build basic infrastructure. This, she claims, strengthens the voices and demands of the people, emphasizing governmental accountability even during economic hardships. Overall, the speaking tone is conversational and analytical.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a formal event at the Center for Strategic & International Studies (CSIS), as indicated by the backdrop displaying the organization's name repeatedly. Initially, a man with gray hair, wearing glasses, a dark suit, a light blue shirt, and an orange and blue striped tie, is seen speaking. The scene then transitions to a woman with short dark hair, wearing glasses, a light blue floral-patterned jacket, and a necklace, who also appears to be speaking. Both individuals are positioned against the same blue backdrop with the CSIS logo, suggesting they are part of a panel or discussion. The atmosphere is professional, and the focus is on the speakers as they engage in dialogue or presentation. The video captures the speakers' expressions and gestures, emphasizing their involvement in the event.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a conversation between a man and a woman, in a relatively formal setting, discussing the impact of economic slowdowns in the US and Europe on Southeast Asian economies. The woman explains Southeast Asia's reliance on trade as an engine of growth, mentioning their high trade-to-GDP ratio and close ties to the US and Europe. She concludes that a slowdown in the US and Europe will directly affect Southeast Asia through trade and financing.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a woman wearing glasses and a patterned blazer, speaking in front of a backdrop with the text "CSIS CENTER FOR STRATEGIC & INTERNATIONAL STUDIES" repeatedly printed on it. She appears to be engaged in a discussion or presentation, as indicated by her hand gestures and facial expressions. The scene transitions to a man in a suit and tie, who is also speaking and appears to be listening attentively to the woman. The background remains consistent throughout, reinforcing the setting of a formal event or conference organized by the Center for Strategic & International Studies. The video captures the dynamic interaction between the two speakers, highlighting their professional attire and the serious atmosphere of the event.
events_list.audio_caption: A female speaker discusses Southeast Asia's efforts to strengthen domestic demand to balance global demand weakening, including potential fiscal space usage through counter-cyclical measures. If this isn't the case, they might face difficulty in external growth while struggling to boost domestic growth with their own resources. The speech is delivered in a formal, analytical tone.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man in a suit and tie, wearing glasses, speaking in front of a backdrop with the text "CSIS CENTER FOR STRATEGIC & INTERNATIONAL STUDIES" repeatedly printed on it. The man appears to be engaged in a conversation or interview, as he is facing another person whose back is visible to the camera. The setting suggests a formal or professional environment, likely related to strategic and international studies. The man's facial expressions and body language indicate that he is actively participating in the discussion, possibly sharing insights or responding to questions. The consistent backdrop and the man's attire contribute to the overall professional atmosphere of the scene.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker inquiring about challenges faced by Southeast Asian economies in attracting foreign investment and fostering a more competitive environment, delivered in a neutral tone. The audio appears to be recorded in a relatively quiet environment, as there is minimal background noise present.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a woman with short black hair and glasses, wearing a blue and white patterned blouse, speaking in front of a blue backdrop with the text "CSIS" and "CENTER FOR STRATEGIC & INTERNATIONAL STUDIES" repeatedly printed on it. She appears to be engaged in a discussion or presentation, as indicated by her facial expressions and hand gestures. The scene transitions to a man with gray hair and glasses, dressed in a dark suit and tie, who also speaks in front of the same backdrop. The video then returns to the woman, who continues to speak and gesture, emphasizing her points. The consistent backdrop and professional attire suggest a formal event or conference setting, likely related to strategic and international studies. The atmosphere is serious and focused, with both individuals appearing to be experts or speakers at the event.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a single, articulate female speaker. She discusses the economic community in Southeast Asia, highlighting its established foundations like lower tariffs and sound macroeconomic policy. She states that Southeast Asia "cannot just stop there" and mentions competitiveness. The speaker sounds thoughtful and informative.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a woman with short black hair and glasses, dressed in a grey and blue patterned jacket, speaking at an event hosted by the Center for Strategic & International Studies (CSIS). She is seen gesturing with her hands as she speaks, indicating an engaging and dynamic presentation. The background prominently displays the CSIS logo and name, reinforcing the formal and professional setting of the event. The woman's facial expressions and body language suggest she is passionately discussing a topic of importance, likely related to international studies or strategic affairs. The video captures her from various angles, including close-ups of her face and upper body, emphasizing her expressions and gestures. The consistent backdrop and her attire maintain a cohesive visual theme throughout the video, highlighting the significance of the event and the speaker's role within it.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip features a single, calm female speaker discussing the importance of investing in human capital and education, citing Indonesia's 20% budget allocation for education. She emphasizes the need to push the frontier in technology advancement, which underscores the importance of investment in research and technology. The speaker's tone is informative and slightly analytical.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a woman and a man speaking at an event hosted by the Center for Strategic & International Studies (CSIS), as indicated by the backdrop. The woman, wearing glasses and a grey floral-patterned jacket, is seen gesturing with her hands while speaking, suggesting she is engaged in a discussion or presentation. The man, dressed in a dark suit with a light blue shirt and an orange-striped tie, appears to be listening attentively or preparing to speak. The setting is formal, with the CSIS logo prominently displayed in the background, reinforcing the professional and academic atmosphere of the event. The video captures the dynamic interaction between the speakers, highlighting their involvement in a serious and focused dialogue.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a female speaker discussing the importance of "connectivity and infrastructure" in addition to "human capital" and "investment on research and technology". She elaborates on the need to "advance to the higher ladder of industrial manufacturing" and build "competitive infrastructure". The speaker's tone is informative and analytical. Following this, the speaker shifts to a more questioning tone.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a formal discussion at the Center for Strategic & International Studies (CSIS), as indicated by the backdrop. It begins with a man in a dark suit, light blue shirt, and orange plaid tie, speaking and gesturing with his hands. The scene transitions to a woman in a grey floral-patterned jacket, who is also speaking and gesturing, indicating an active conversation. The video alternates between close-ups of the woman and wider shots showing both individuals engaged in dialogue. The consistent backdrop and professional attire suggest a serious, academic, or policy-related discussion. The video captures the dynamic exchange between the two speakers, emphasizing their points with hand gestures and facial expressions.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip features one female speaker discussing how Southeast Asian countries have been tackling corruption. She summarizes that these countries have experience in dealing with corruption, citing examples from Indonesia and the Philippines, then notes that these countries recognize corruption as an obstacle to development. She says many countries are investing in reforms to strengthen law enforcement and judicial systems, noting this will take time, but the path is already being built. The speaker concludes by saying that many have an uneven start.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a woman standing in front of a backdrop with the text "CSIS CENTER FOR STRATEGIC & INTERNATIONAL STUDIES" repeatedly printed on it. She is wearing a grey and blue patterned blazer and a necklace, and she appears to be speaking, as indicated by her mouth movements and hand gestures. The woman is wearing glasses and has short, dark hair. Throughout the video, she maintains a professional demeanor, occasionally gesturing with her hands to emphasize her points. The background remains consistent, with the CSIS logo and text clearly visible, suggesting that the setting is likely a formal event or presentation related to the Center for Strategic & International Studies. The woman's expressions and gestures convey a sense of engagement and authority as she addresses her audience.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip features a single, female speaker, who sounds professional, discussing the success of Singapore in building good governance and anti-corruption, noting that they stay at the top level in terms of perception of doing business and enjoying long robust growth. She mentions other Southeast Asian countries looking at this and trying to simplify regulations and policies to reduce corruption.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a woman with short dark hair and glasses, wearing a blue patterned jacket, speaking at an event organized by the Center for Strategic & International Studies (CSIS). The backdrop is a blue banner with the CSIS logo and text, indicating the formal and professional setting of the event. Throughout the video, the woman is seen making various facial expressions and gestures, such as raising her hand to emphasize a point, suggesting she is engaged in delivering a speech or presentation. The camera focuses on her upper body and face, capturing her expressions and movements as she speaks. The consistent background and her attire maintain a cohesive visual theme, emphasizing the importance of the event and the speaker's role within it.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip features one female speaker who acknowledges that progress in certain areas may be mixed, citing setbacks and advancements in different regions. She emphasizes the need to strengthen good governance and anti-corruption efforts in Southeast Asia, advocating for increased investment in law enforcement, rule of law, and an impartial judicial system.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man in a suit and tie standing in front of a blue backdrop with the text "CSIS" and "CENTER FOR STRATEGIC & INTERNATIONAL STUDIES" repeatedly printed on it. He appears to be speaking, as his mouth moves and his facial expressions change. The scene then transitions to a woman wearing glasses and a floral-patterned jacket, also standing in front of the same blue backdrop with the CSIS logo. She seems to be listening attentively, with her head slightly tilted. The video then shifts to a series of blue screens with white text, displaying the words "AUDIO," "EVENTS," "AT," and "CSIS.ORG," each on separate screens. The final screen shows the CSIS logo and the full name of the organization, "CENTER FOR STRATEGIC & INTERNATIONAL STUDIES," along with the website address "CSIS.ORG." The overall atmosphere of the video is professional and informative, with a focus on the CSIS organization and its events.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker thanking a female speaker, identified as Ibu Sri Mulyani, the managing director of the World Bank, for joining them. Both speakers sound polite and formal. Light, cheerful music then begins. It sounds like a corporate jingle with acoustic guitars and gentle orchestration.
